intro: Eulobus angelorum, commonly known as the angel's eulobus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Eulobus angelorum is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
